title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - REVISED
description: Revised and expanded detailed requirements for the AISecurityAuditor project. The scope includes the detection of various security vulnerabilities (e.g., code vulnerabilities, misconfigured infrastructure, outdated dependencies, unpatched software, insecure data handling, insufficient access controls), across multiple environments (source code repositories, cloud infrastructure, containerized environments, network devices, databases). The desired output formats for vulnerability reports include human-readable reports, machine-readable formats for integration with other tools, API endpoints for real-time alerts. Integration points with existing security tools and processes are to be established (e.g., CI/CD pipelines, issue tracking systems, notification mechanisms, incident response workflows). The AI system's recommendations will cover suggesting remediation strategies and providing contextual guidance for developers. This task remains in progress and is assigned to the code-architect.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture for the AISecurityAuditor, including the components for scanning codebases, dependencies, and infrastructure configurations, as well as the AI-powered vulnerability detection and reporting modules.

title: Develop Scanning and Auditing Modules
description: Implement the modules for scanning codebases, dependencies, and infrastructure configurations, as well as the AI-powered vulnerability detection and reporting modules.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and implement the user interface for the AISecurityAuditor, allowing users to configure scanning settings, view vulnerability reports, and manage the auditing process.

title: Set up Infrastructure and Deployment
description: Set up the necessary infrastructure and deployment pipelines for the AISecurityAuditor, including hosting environments, continuous integration and delivery processes, and monitoring and logging systems.

title: Conduct Security Audits and Testing
description: Perform comprehensive security audits and testing on the AISecurityAuditor system, including penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and compliance checks.

title: Develop Documentation and Training Materials
description: Create comprehensive documentation and training materials for the AISecurityAuditor, including user guides, technical documentation, and training resources for administrators and end-users.

title: Perform Quality Assurance and Testing
description: Conduct thorough quality assurance and testing activities, including unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing, to ensure the AISecurityAuditor meets all functional and non-functional requirements.

title: Deploy and Monitor AISecurityAuditor
description: Deploy the AISecurityAuditor to production environments, monitor its performance and usage, and implement processes for ongoing maintenance, updates, and support.
